page.title: 10SCORES - LOWESTOFT
page.content: One of the characteristics of LOWESTOFT is the many flights of steps or roads leading down from the main roads especially the High Street, Yarmouth Road, and the shopping area leading down to the commercial area of the Denes. These roads are called 'SCORES' as in the early days they were just dirt tracks and looked like the scratches made on the skin of a side of pork. The land at the foot of the scores was protected from sea erosion by the building of a concrete breakwater and a sea wall. The scores were always connected with the fishing industry - eg.Rope Walk. Part of the area is still used for the drying of fishing nets today.
